reviewText:
This game can be a LOT of fun when people actually play it right!

1. The devs need to do something about the immature and offensive names that players choose.  They keep CLAIMING that they take reports seriously, but I have seen no evidence of them doing anything about it.

2. Something needs to be done about REPEAT quitters!  People who join a lobby and wait until the timer is at 2 seconds and then leave just to troll everyone else.  Not to mention in game quitters who leave before the game even goes to the first night because they don't like the role that they got.

3. Town members who are killed that quit.... something needs to be done about that as well.  It screws over the medium's role.  What point is there in having a medium if everyone who dies leaves the game because they are sore losers?

This game is meant to be fun for everyone who plays it.  But lately I have had the fun sapped out of it because of the above problems.  The devs keep claiming that they are going to impliment features that punish people who quit and use offensive names... but nothing has been done yet.  I have been playing this game for several months now on both Steam and Facebook.  It's time for the developers to take care of the trash players in this game so that the REAL players can fully enjoy it!

I won't recommend this game to a friend until the above problems are fixed.

reviewText:
Town of Salem is based on the games Mafia and Werewolf.

There are 15 players, 3 Alignments (Town, Mafia, Neutrals) and a sh*tload of roles that are give randomly to the players. The fun about it? Nobody knows anything, except these damn skypers... (no, just joking, never seen one personally ingame). Town players need to find other town while mafia and neutrals kills one by one of them.

Here's a little warning:
It took me around 80 hours ingame to understand the WHOLE game (with ALL roles). Since you can only play the Classic mode (or fun modes) at the beginning 'til you've won 50 games. Then you can play ranked and all roles are available. To make it easy, play for yourself at first, don't play with a friend that knows the game and tries to explain it to you while you play. It's just confusing.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Gameplay?

Town:
In short there are 4 parts of the town:
Town Support: Supports the town by blocking other people or by transporting them. Aswell as revealing and mayor game tf out of you.
Town Protect: Heals other players or defends them (and kills the attacker)
Town Invest: Can investigate roles of other players or can see their alignment"
Town Killing: Obviously they revive... kill other players.

Town wins when they killed all Neutral Evils / Killings and Mafias. They don't know each other and can only communicate at day time. Things such as Whispers
date:
Last Wills and a democratic voting system make sure that everyone has a fair say in who dies and who is innocent. No one person (excluding the Mayor) has a bigger say than any other person.

Mafia:
Mafia Support: Can blackmail other players or block them
Mafia Deception: Can clean roles from other players or fake their wills.
Mafia Killing: ...

Neutrals:
The neutrals are interesting
recommended: as they don't follow the normal structure.\nNeutral evil:\nThey are evil
hoursPlayed: in their role description
voteText: but the players often will help the town when they help them reach their goal.\nThe executioner
helpfulPercent: for example
votesHelpful:
needs to get one town player lynched.

Neutral killing:
They fight all alone
votesTotal: except the neutral evil are really evil one time. There are currently 3 killing roles
votesFunny: the serial killer (1 kill every night)
commentsCount: the werewolf (1 kill + all player that visit the target every 2nd night) and the arsonist (damn slow
column16: first douse your targets
column17: then 8 nights later
column18:
ignite).

Neutral benign:
Easy roles
column19:
just shout "SURVIVOR HERE" at the beginning and you are (maybe) safe and able to go afk without problems.

Note that there are many more roles and i just talked about 1/4.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

All in all
column20: Town Of Salem is an extremely fun game based on lying and bluffing
column21: with an awesome community that is crazy af.\nBut why should i buy it on steam when i can play it in my browser FOR FREE?\nThe steam client is (imo) better then the browser. Although the client is lagging a little bit lately. If you want to stream or record your sessions
column22: the client is the better choice. And you get town points worth your 5€.\n\n10/10 would buy again."

reviewText:
I find this game amazing! Be a serial killer and kill off everyone, be a towns person and be killed by the baddies or be the head of the mafia guiding your minions to do the dirty work so you can take over the town! Or be the minion and help kill off other town members who oppose your organization! Or be an arsonist and burn your victims alive at night! Or be the jailor and arrest people or protect important figures in the community. Or be a werewolf and eat the town up! Lots of fun for everyone! Lots of town jobs and bad jobs! Also its all against other players so it gets even more interesting!

Players are randomly divided into alignments at the start into town, mafia, serial killers, arsonists, witches, werewolves, or neutrals. Games range from 7 to 15 players and no one knows whos who at the start. The catch is to survive and find out who your enemies are before they get rid of you. Get hanged, beaten, stabbed, possessed, murdered, burned alive, maimed, executed, accidently killed, shot, and or commit suicide. Lots of customization options available to make your look unique to all other players from your home, to your character, to your exectution animation from drowning, hanging, or the cutting block and a bunch more. Have pets that stay beside you and so on. Players in the game will see your selections. Name yourself anything you want at the start of each game.

An awesome game that I enjoy and you might to!

reviewText: One night I poured a little gasoline on this guy's head cause he was being a jerk.  The smell was so intoxicating that I decided to do it again the next night, and the next.  Then on the fourth night I was playing with a lighter thinking how wonderful it would be to see them all go up in flames... so I lit em up.  I knew the town would probably catch me, but I thought, hey the flames are worth it.  But that night there was an even bigger inferno than I expected.  It turned out half the town was burnt to cinders.  And they all left the same death note... which wasn't mine.  Somehow the townies caught on to the other arsonist and lynched him good, and then they thought 'good, we're safe now, we killed the bad guy'.  So I bided my time and doused some quiet ones until there were just four of us left.  I had doused 2 of them already, but I knew the mafia would know who I was the next day if I didn't kill them.  So I took the chance and lit them all up.  And low and behold, the mafia had decided to kill that very same fourth person who was left, leaving me all alone, Queen of the Fire.\n\nSeriously this game rocks, you can play it over and over again and no two games are the same.  Best $5 I ever spent on a free browser game (but I don't even care cause it's that good).

reviewText:
This game looks absolutely childish.

But in truth it actually has depth and fun.  It is a deceit and logic based game mix in some group lemming mentality and you have yourself hours and hours of fun.

I played 20 hours within a 30 hour time period.  It is that fun.  I have to actually force myself  to quit, it's that addicting.

These guys did a great job.  But it IS Free to Play.  Just not on Steam.  It is a browser based game and has a cash shop that only sells cosmetic items, and you earn enough coins to get those cosmetic items.

After about 50 matches I had enough to buy me a pet.  Just for cosmetic, as how you look or what you live in, or even your name in the game, has zero bearing on the outcome.  Each game lasts between 20-30 minutes.

If you dont want to pay the $5 from steam (you get $5 worth of coins basically) then play it from their website, just google it.

reviewText:
I HIGHLY recommend buying this game on steam.
I won't lie and say that the steam version is epically superior to the free browser-based version, because in all honesty, it isn't. Sure, it's ad-free, maybe a little faster, and you can see your friends playing it (assuming they have the steam version).
But you can get rid of ads with adblock and open up steam separately to see your friends.
I also won't say that the 5 dollars worth of town points (the in-game currency) you get included with the steam version is a super-big deal either. You can get free town points just by playing the game.
But if anything, this is an even BIGGER reason to get the steam version. Blankmediagames is a very unique company in that they don't try and trick you into paying money for a so-called freemium" game. Paying for town points does not give you any form of advantage over other players; they are used purely for aesthetics. And if looking cool in-game is that important to you
recommended: you can get town points just by playing!\nThe real reason you should pay for the steam version is because by giving the creators money
hoursPlayed: you enable them to continue improving the game faster than they would have without that money. All those epic stretch goals they listed on kickstarter? Your 5 dollars will help make them a reality.\nSo yes
voteText: I am literally telling you to give them your money with no significant immediate reward.\n\nIf you're still unsure
helpfulPercent: I'd suggest playing the game for free a bit to make sure you like it. But don't hold me responsible if you get addicted (says the guy with 100+ hours logged on steam alone). Speaking of which
votesHelpful: here are some helpful tips that might make getting into the game a little easier
votesTotal: as it can be rather confusing at first:\n1. The other players use LOTS of abbreviations. Here's a helpful list of what they all mean: http://town-of-salem.wikia.com/wiki/Glossary_of_Abbreviations\n2(a). There are many different "roles" in Town of Salem which are assigned to all the players randomly. It can be a bit rough at the beginning if you don't know what any of the roles do. Here's another helpful link to help you with that: http://town-of-salem.wikia.com/wiki/Roles. It might seem overwhelming
votesFunny: but after you've played a bit
commentsCount: you'll start to get a feel for what the roles are.\n2(b). If you don't wanna waste time reading through the roles
column16: play Classic Mode first. This will give you a general feel for the game and how it's played.\n3. Move on to Custom Mode. This can be a real pain
column17: because regardless of the game
column18: there will ALWAYS be trolls in a community. In Custom Mode the game randomly chooses a player to be "host"
column19: meaning he/she will choose the role list for the game. They don't actually choose who gets what role
column20: but they still have a huge influence on the kind of game it will be. However
column21: playing Custom Mode is important because it allows you to play roles that would seldom or never be found in Classic. It helps you get a handle on the various roles from first-hand experience
column22: not just from reading their details off the wiki.  For example

reviewText:
In Town of Salem, you are given a role. Your role could be part of the town, like a doctor or a veteran, or part of something much more evil, like a serial killer or a mafia member. The game plays like a metaphorical game of cards. You could be the doctor, and be pressured by everyone else into revealing yourself; if you do, you could become a target for the bad guys, and if you don’t, the town could decide to lynch you.

Each game consists of a day/night cycle. During the day cycle, the players discuss the night’s happening and share their suspicions or evidence an evil character. During the night, everyone’s ability is used. Some abilities kill other players, while others simply block another person’s ability or discover a player’s role.

If the majority of players agree that a player is evil, then they could vote to put him on trial. When the trail is in progress, the accused can plead a case: then, the town votes if they believe the player is guilty or innocent. If the player is found innocent, the town can vote to put another person on trail. If found guilty, the player will be hanged and the day will immediately end.

reviewText:
I HIGHLY recommend buying this game on steam.
I won't lie and say that the steam version is epically superior to the free browser-based version, because in all honesty, it isn't. Sure, it's ad-free, maybe a little faster, and you can see your friends playing it (assuming they have the steam version).
But you can get rid of ads with adblock and open up steam separately to see your friends.
I also won't say that the 5 dollars worth of town points (the in-game currency) you get included with the steam version is a super-big deal either. You can get free town points just by playing the game.
But if anything, this is an even BIGGER reason to get the steam version. Blankmediagames is a very unique company in that they don't try and trick you into paying money for a so-called freemium" game. Paying for town points does not give you any form of advantage over other players; they are used purely for aesthetics. And if looking cool in-game is that important to you
recommended: you can get town points just by playing!\nThe real reason you should pay for the steam version is because by giving the creators money
hoursPlayed: you enable them to continue improving the game faster than they would have without that money. All those epic stretch goals they listed on kickstarter? Your 5 dollars will help make them a reality.\nSo yes
voteText: I am literally telling you to give them your money with no significant immediate reward.\n\nIf you're still unsure
helpfulPercent: I'd suggest playing the game for free a bit to make sure you like it. But don't hold me responsible if you get addicted (says the guy with 100+ hours logged on steam alone). Speaking of which
votesHelpful: here are some helpful tips that might make getting into the game a little easier
votesTotal: as it can be rather confusing at first:\n1. The other players use LOTS of abbreviations. Here's a helpful list of what they all mean: http://town-of-salem.wikia.com/wiki/Glossary_of_Abbreviations\n2(a). There are many different "roles" in Town of Salem which are assigned to all the players randomly. It can be a bit rough at the beginning if you don't know what any of the roles do. Here's another helpful link to help you with that: http://town-of-salem.wikia.com/wiki/Roles. It might seem overwhelming
votesFunny: but after you've played a bit
commentsCount: you'll start to get a feel for what the roles are.\n2(b). If you don't wanna waste time reading through the roles
column16: play Classic Mode first. This will give you a general feel for the game and how it's played.\n3. Move on to Custom Mode. This can be a real pain
column17: because regardless of the game
column18: there will ALWAYS be trolls in a community. In Custom Mode the game randomly chooses a player to be "host"
column19: meaning he/she will choose the role list for the game. They don't actually choose who gets what role
column20: but they still have a huge influence on the kind of game it will be. However
column21: playing Custom Mode is important because it allows you to play roles that would seldom or never be found in Classic. It helps you get a handle on the various roles from first-hand experience
column22: not just from reading their details off the wiki.  For example
column24: you'd think that if someone got the role "Survivor"
column26: right? But I've seen many towns lynch survivors
column27: either because they thought they were lying or simply because they were unaligned. I have seen the mafia kill survivors for similar reasons.\n4. Play the game. By now
column28: you've probably gotten pretty used to the roles
column30: and community of Town of Salem. If you've played 50 games without quitting
column31: you will have Ranked Mode unlocked
column32: which as of now is basically just a setup most players consider balanced. In the future Blankmediagames will add rankings and stats as well. Still
column33: most ranked players are more experienced than those in the other modes
column34:
and you won't have to worry about afk hosts.
